mas.jobproxy

Class Batch

  • java.lang.Object
    • mas.jobproxy.Batch
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Batch
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Represents a batch of jobs
    Author:
    Anand Prajapati

      • getCustomerId

        public java.lang.String getCustomerId()
        Returns:
        id of the customer who ordered this batch

      • setCustomerId

        public void setCustomerId(java.lang.String customerId)

        Parameters:
        customerId -

      • getRegretMultiplier

        public double getRegretMultiplier()
        Returns:
        Regret multiplier for this batch. This multiplier is used for calculation of penalty while creating schedules. Multiplier depends upon regret of the batch

      • getSlack

        public long getSlack()
        Returns:
        The slack for this batch.

      • setSlack

        public void setSlack(long slack)
        set the slack for this batch. Slack is the extra amount of time that we have before the batch gets delayed. Batch can be delayed by this much amount without being actually late or causing any penalty.
        Parameters:
        slack -

      • getRegret

        public double getRegret()
        Returns:
        regret for this batch

      • setRegret

        public void setRegret(double regret)
        Sets regret for this batch. Regret for any batch is defined as lateness/slack
        Parameters:
        regret -

      • getCPN

      • getBidByLSA

        public double getBidByLSA()
        Returns:
        Bid by Local Scheduling agent for this batch. This is used while bidding for batches. GSA advertises new batch and all Local scheduling agents send their bid for the advertised batch.

      • setBidByLSA

        public void setBidByLSA(double bidByLSA)
        Set Bid by Local scheduling agent for this batch.
        Parameters:
        bidByLSA -

      • getPosition

        public int getPosition()
        Returns:
        position of this batch in the batch-queue of machine. This is used only while scheduling.

      • setPosition

        public void setPosition(int position)
        Sets position of this batch in the batch-queue of machine. This is used only while scheduling.
        Parameters:
        position -

      • getTotalBatchProcessingTime

        public long getTotalBatchProcessingTime()
        Returns:
        total processing time for this batch ( include processing time for all jobs and all operations)

      • isBatchComplete

      • getExpectedDueDate

        public long getExpectedDueDate()
        Returns:
        Expected due date for this batch. This is used while negotiating for a new order. On arrival of a new order, GSA calculates and sets expected due date for the batch.

      • getCurrentOperationCompletionTime

      • getCurrentOperationProcessingTime

        public long getCurrentOperationProcessingTime()
        Returns:
        processing time for current operation of whole batch

      • setCurrentOperationProcessingTime

        public void setCurrentOperationProcessingTime(long processingTime)
        set processing time for current operation for each job in the batch. processingTime is the time for one job of the corresponding operation in the batch and not for the whole batch. Processing time should be passed in milliseconds.
        Parameters:
        processingTime -
